summary: A notes app with configurable label/tag management. The Notes section supports user-managed labels (add, rename, delete) while preserving the 'All' label and existing filtering behavior. Labels persist using the app's existing storage system.
architectural_notes: 'All' label is permanent and cannot be renamed or deleted
Labels persist using the app's existing storage mechanism (no new storage systems)
On first run, initialize labels: All, Welcome, Work, Personal, Ideas
Deleting a label reassigns affected notes to 'All' safely

existing_features.title: Update the useLabels hook to expose createLabel, updateLabel (except for 'All'), and deleteLabel (except for 'All') operations. When a label is deleted, all notes that reference that label must be safely reassigned to 'All' (or have the label reference removed) without breaking any existing note data.

Expose label management UI through the existing LabelManager modal component (frontend/src/components/notes/LabelManager.tsx) so users can add new labels, rename existing labels (except 'All'), and delete existing labels (except 'All'). Do not change the Notes page layout, label filter bar appearance, or any other UI outside of what is strictly required for this management interface.

new_feature_requests.summary: Make note labels/tags configurable: add, rename, delete (except 'All'), with persistence and safe reassignment on deletion

Extend the backend (or existing storage layer) to persist user-defined labels. On first run, initialize with the default set: All, Welcome, Work, Personal, Ideas. The 'All' label must always exist and cannot be renamed or deleted.

Ensure the label filter bar in NotesPage continues to read labels dynamically from the persisted labels list (via useLabels or equivalent), so newly added, renamed, or deleted labels are immediately reflected in the filter options without any page reload.
